title: U.S. space weather policy is alive and well but is insufficiently funded
summary: Policy is not the impediment to increasing space weather preparedness in the United States; the lack of funding is. U.S. space weather policy is alive and well under the continued […]

title: NASA astronaut Don Pettit to make fourth trip to the International Space Station
summary: Pettit will fly to the orbiting outpost alongside Russian cosmonauts Alexey Ovchinin and Ivan Vagner on the Soyuz MS-26 mission. Liftoff from the Baikonur Cosmodrome is set for 12:23 p.m. EDT (1623 UTC).

title: Astroscale and ClearSpace get funds to advance double satellite de-orbit mission
summary: The UK Space Agency has awarded funds to consortiums led by Astroscale and ClearSpace to continue developing a servicer capable of removing two spacecraft from low Earth orbit in 2026.

title: Report highlights severe infrastructure challenges at NASA
summary: A new report concludes that infrastructure and workforce challenges will soon require NASA to make tough choices about what missions to continue to conduct unless it receives a significant budget increase.

title: Landspace completes 10-kilometer reusable rocket test, eyes 2025 orbital launch
summary: HELSINKI — Chinese launch startup Landspace conducted a 10-kilometer vertical liftoff, vertical landing test at Jiuquan spaceport Wednesday as it develops a reusable orbital rocket. The Zhuque-3 VTVL-1 reusable vertical […]

title: Below the surface - ExoMars Rosalind Franklin mission
summary: Watch the second episode of the ExoMars Rosalind Franklin rover mission – Europe’s ambitious exploration journey to search for past and present signs of life on Mars.

title: Episode 2 – Below the surface
summary: Watch the second episode of the ExoMars Rosalind Franklin rover mission – Europe’s ambitious exploration journey to search for past and present signs of life on Mars.

title: Congress, industry criticize FAA launch licensing regulations
summary: Members of Congress and the space industry criticized the Federal Aviation Administration for implementation of launch licensing regulations they claim threaten American competitiveness in space.

title: Margin’ up the Crater Rim!
summary: To conclude its exploration of the mysterious margin unit before it ascends the rim of Jezero Crater, Perseverance made one last stop this past week to investigate these strange rocks at “Eremita Mesa.” Since beginning its steep drive up the crater rim, Perseverance has been traversing along the edge of the margin unit (the margin […]

title: OneWeb launches alternative navigation service amid GPS vulnerability concerns
summary: The new service uses a software-defined outdoor receiver that can access PNT signals from both traditional global navigation satellite systems and alternative sources such as Iridium satellites
